Package roborally.game.gameboard.objects.laser

Class Laser

  • java.lang.Object
    • roborally.game.gameboard.objects.laser.Laser
  • public class Laser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the logic involved in robots shooting lasers fireLaser(com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2, int). Mainly it handles the static lasers projected by cannons on the map, each time a robot goes into a laser it is updated here through LaserRegister.

      Constructors

      Laser​(int laserTileID, ILayers layers)
      Constructs a new laser.

      • Laser

        public Laser​(int laserTileID,
             ILayers layers)
        Constructs a new laser.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • clearLaser

        public void clearLaser()

      • fireLaser

        public void fireLaser​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 pos,
                      int robotDirection)
        Shoots a laser until it hits a wall or a robot. Stores the cells for clearing them after. setDirection(int robotDirection) to figure out the iterative values to shoot with.
        Parameters:
        pos - GridPoint2 position of the robot.
        robotDirection - The robotDirection the robot is looking.

      • setDirection

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 setDirection​(int robotDirection)
        Determines which robotDirection the robot is firing it's laser.
        Parameters:
        robotDirection - The robotDirection the robot is facing
        Returns:
        an array with values that determines which robotDirection the laser is being fired.

      • findLaser

        public void findLaser​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 robotsOrigin)
        Finds the laser cannon and adds the coordinates of its projected laser.
        Parameters:
        robotsOrigin - The position the robot is or was currently in.

      • findHorizontal

        public int findHorizontal()
        Finds the cannon projecting a horizontal laser, and stores the cells of the laser. Calls findCannon(int, int, int) with values where the laser cells end in a horizontal line.
        Returns:
        cannonId

      • findVertical

        public int findVertical()
        Finds the cannon projecting a vertical laser, and stores laser cells. Calls findCannon(int, int, int) with values where the laser cells end in a vertical line.
        Returns:
        cannonId

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the cannon when there is activity, and continues to do so until it is registered in Lasers that no robot is no longer active in the laser. Calls identifyLaser(int, int, boolean) to handle cross-lasers.

      • gotPos

        public boolean gotPos​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 pos)
        Checks if the given laser contains the position queried.
        Parameters:
        pos - GridPoint2 of the position queried.
        Returns:
        true if the position is in the list of positions the laser consists of.

      • clearStoredCoordinates

        public void clearStoredCoordinates()

      • getCoords

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2> getCoords()

      • identifyLaser

        public boolean identifyLaser​(int i,
                             int j,
                             boolean create)
        Identifies when to different laser cells intersect, creates a cross laser.
        Parameters:
        i - the x-position of the cell
        j - the y-position of the cell
        create - true if it is putting lasers back, false if it is removing laser cells.
        Returns:
        false if there is a cross-laser present, or if logic determines there to be one.

      • getPosition

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.GridPoint2 getPosition()

      • getLaser

        public com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapTileLayer.Cell getLaser​(int laserDirection)
        Create laser tiles if they are not created.
        Parameters:
        laserDirection - the direction the laser is going
        Returns:
        the laser cell.
